page.title: 18DOGMERSFIELD AREA FARMING
page.content:
Most of the land in this area comprises farming land. There are large areas of permanent pasture alongside arable land. There are also numerous copses of deciduous trees amongst the fields. The grassland is used for cattle grazing. The arable land is in large expanses formed from several older fields with the hedgerows removed. Wheat, barley and oats are grown. Dogmersfield Park, formerly the grounds of Dogmersfield House, is also used for farming with the same combination of arable and pasture land.
ODIHAM WOMEN'S INSTITUTE 1985
